content.short: Contemporary one bedroom apartment, for up to four people, in the Vondelpark area in Amsterdam, close to the Museum District.
content.full:
Contemporary one bedroom apartment, for up to four people, in the Vondelpark area in Amsterdam, close to the Museum District.

This stunning apartment is situated in a traditional Amsterdam building, recently renovated to effortlessly blend the modern with the historical. The living room is extremely spacious with antique ceilings and large windows that allow in plenty of natural light. The space is furnished with two sofas, a double sofa-bed, a dining table with seating for all guests and a television and DVD player. The open kitchen is modern and stylish and fully equipped with everything needed to prepare meals in the apartment, including an oven, hob, a microwave, a grill, a fridge, a freezer, a dishwasher, a toaster and a coffee machine. A flight of stairs leads to the second floor where you will find the traditional bedroom complete with sloping roof and original construction beams. The bedroom is spacious and comes furnished with a double bed, two single beds which can easily be put together and seating. Please note that there also is a baby cot available upon request. The bathroom with nice stained glass windows is contemporary and comes with a shower or a bath and another separate shower, washbasin and toilet. The top floor room also provides access to a charming balcony and is the ideal place to enjoy that morning coffee or evening glass of wine. Located close to the Vondelpark and the Museum Quarter, this apartment is ideal for business and leisure travellers after stylish accommodation in the heart of the city.Please be inform apartment has steep stairs.

Registration number: 0363 029E F19E 22A5 8AEA
content.area: This apartment is located on the outskirts of the Central Canal Belt just a 100 metres from Vondelpark and a short distance from Leidseplein and the Museum District. The view from the apartment is that of a wide Canal. Just a short distance from the apartment is the Museum Quarter home to several of the city’s largest museums including the Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum and the Stedelijk Museum. The district is also home to the Concert Hall and numerous bars, cafes and restaurants. Vondel Park, the largest park in the city, is just a 100 metre walk away and is the perfect place to relax on a warm afternoon. Leidseplein is close by and is one of Amsterdam’s nightlife hubs filled with bars, cafes, restaurants, nightclubs and live music venues. If you are a beer lover, why not visit the former Heineken Brewery, just a short distance from the apartment and although it no longer brews beer, you can take the tour and learn the history of the brewery and beer itself. This apartment is located in the perfect position, with numerous attractions within walking distance, and public transport links available for those places not reachable on foot.
content.arrival:
Dear guest,

Welcome to the ‘Canal Holiday’ apartment!

The owners of the apartment (bottom) will welcome you (most likely) at the apartment and help you with checking in and help you with other questions you might have upon arrival.

Please read the following information carefully as it provides you with the information for a smooth check-in.

Please inform us via borninfotos@gmail.com with your estimated time of arrival as soon as possible (please note the number 1 at the end of the apartment name!).

Once you have arrived at Schiphol airport, Amsterdam Central Station or have entered Amsterdam’s city ring please contact us on the check-in telephone number +31 655340345 (first contact number) or +31 652657283. This will enable us to estimate your arrival time at the apartment.

Check in

Check-in is at the apartment (address: Sloterkade 19, 2nd floor, 1058 HD Amsterdam) between 14:00 and 20:00 local time (CET). An early or late check-in can allways be requested and if possible, it cost 10 euro per full hour extra.

Check out

Check-out is between 8.00 and 11.00 local time (CET). An early or late check-in can allways be requested and if possible, it cost 10 euro per full hour extra.

Payment

The balance due (incl. VAT & Tourist tax) must be paid upon arrival at the apartment. This final payment is done by cash only. (Unless you have already paid by bank transfer). If you don't like to pay in cash, get in touch with us directly, details see bottom.

Security Deposit

We require a security deposit upon check in. We will hold Euro 150 in cash upon check-in. This amount will be returned to you in cash during check-out on the conditions that you have left the apartment in a good condition and no disturbance has occurred.

You pay no extra cleaning costs if you leave the apartment as you have found the accommodation.

Keys will only be handed out, when the final payment is received and the security deposit is settled.

A washing machine and iron and ironing board are available in the apartment.

We look forward to meeting you upon your arrival and wish you a safe trip!

Kind regards,

Paul & Els

Paul Born (first contact person), phone: +31 655340345

or Els Born Oudeman, phone: +31 652657283

email: borninfotos@gmail.com

content.short: Amazingly charming, one bedroom apartment, for up to two people in the trendy Nine Streets in the Jordaan area of Amsterdam.
content.full:
Amazingly charming, one bedroom apartment for up to two people, in the trendy Nine Streets.

If you are looking for something just that little bit different, then this 90m2 apartment, situated in a historic building on one of the main Amsterdam canals, could be what you are looking for. The warm and welcoming living area, contains two sofas, a TV and DVD player, a well stocked bookcase, a coffee table and interesting art pieces. The kitchen is finished to a high standard and includes a microwave, hob, fridge freezer and a dishwasher. There is also a glass dining table with chairs. The beautiful ensuite bedroom, up a winding staircase, is nestled beneath the beams, offers views across the rooftops and is furnished with a double bed. The well-finished bathroom is fitted with a bath, shower and toilet. Amenities include Wifi, a hair dryer, fans and a front facing balcony – great to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or a cold beer. In short, a beautiful, unique and surprising apartment, right in the heart of the city. Please note that there are steep stairs to climb in the apartment.

Registration Number: 0363 85F1 CF0E 660E FFF6
content.area:
The Prinsengracht is one of Amsterdam’s four main canals. In the heart of the trendy Jordaan district, with its eclectic collection of boutiques, cafés and restaurants, the apartment is a perfect base from which to explore the city (and its nightlife).

The Palace on Dam Square, the hectic Kalverstraat shopping street and the calm of the Vondel park are all only a short walk away. Visit the tempting Lindengracht food market on a Saturday morning, or walk round the corner to the farmers' market on the Noordermarkt. Also within easy walking distance are the “Negen straatjes” (9 streets), home to many of Amsterdam’s exciting smaller boutiques. Just a five minute walk away is the Museumplein, home to the Van Gogh Museum, the newly reopened Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art and the Rijksmuseum with its collection of world renowned masterworks. Something for every taste!

For those of you who want to venture a little further afield, hop on one of the many trams to take you across Amsterdam. The main train station, Central Station is also just a stone’s throw away.

content.short: Comfortable one-bedroom apartment with garden, for up to four guests, in the trendy and upcoming West area of Amsterdam.
content.full:
Comfortable one-bedroom apartment with garden, for up to four guests, in the trendy and upcoming West area of Amsterdam.

This stylish and comfortable apartment, is perfect for two couples or a family, wanting to explore the city but also wanting some time to relax. With easy access to the city centre and far enough away from it all, this apartment has the best of both worlds. The cosy living area has a large sofa (converts to a double bed), where you will be able to sit and watch the flat screen television (with cable). There is a dining table too, with ample room for four. There is a microwave, a kettle, and a coffee machine. The bedroom is simply decorated, with a double bed and extra washbasin. The bathroom has a shower. The garden, accessible from the kitchenette down a staircase, is a wonderful spot to relax after a busy day of sightseeing. With enough garden furniture, you will be able to sit down and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening sunshine.  If you are looking for an apartment with the bonus of some outside space, then this could be what you are looking for. With both balcony AND garden, you will be able to enjoy the Amsterdam sunshine to your heart’s content.

Registration number: 0363 A10B D120 6049 82F5
content.area:
This apartment is situated in the West of the City, and is close to all the amenities you may need. Want a bite to eat? Restaurants and cafés are plentiful, and for those who prefer to cook at home – there are plenty of shops in the neighbourhood too. If relaxation is your thing, then the Erasmus Park is a stone’s throw away, or take a walk to the famous Vondel Park. If you like  shopping, a short tram ride will take you to the heart of Amsterdam’s most exclusive shopping street, the PC Hooftstraat, with designer shops galore.

The Palace on Dam Square and the hectic Kalverstraat shopping street are all only a cycle or tram ride away. Visit the tempting Lindengracht food market on a Saturday morning, or the farmers' market on the Noordermarkt. Just half an hour away is the Museumplein, home to the Van Gogh Museum, the newly reopened Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art and the Rijksmuseum with its collection of world renowned masterworks. Something for every taste!

The apartment is well situated for getting around Amsterdam. Central Station is just a short tram ride away.
content.arrival:
Dear guest,

Thank you for booking your Amsterdam apartment with us!

Please read the following information carefully as it provides you with the information for a smooth check-in.

Please inform us via email info@10minutes2center.nl with your estimated time of arrival as soon as possible.

Once you have arrived at Schiphol airport, Amsterdam Central Station or enter Amsterdam’s city ring please contact us on our check-in telephone +31 630040156

This will enable us to estimate your arrival time at the apartment.

Check-in

Check-in is at the apartment (address: Baetostraat 9HS) from 14:00.

An early check-in between before 14:00 is not always possible, but can be requested. For availability, please contact us two days prior to your arrival.

Check-out

Check-out is before 11:00 in the morning. A late check-out (till 18:00) can be requested. Please note that this depends on the availability of the apartment.

From Schiphol
Taxi: from the airport to 10minutes2center is 15 km. A taxi from the airport to 10minutes2center costs about 40 Euro,-.

Apartment 1, theme the Netherlands: Baetostraat 9hTrain from Schiphol airport: journey takes about 30 minutes and costs about 6 Euro,-. Take the train from Schiphol airport to Station Sloterdijk. There you take bus 15 and get off at the Bos en Lommerplein. Walk back a bit towards the Bos en Lommerplein and turn right at the traffic light. Proceed until supermarket Dirk van den Broek en turn left to cross the street. On the opposite side of the street turn right. After about 50 meters a Turkish eatery "Birtat" can be found on the corner of the Baetostraat. 10minutes2center theme the Netherlands is located at Baetostraat 9h.

Public transport from Amsterdam Central Station: Bus 21: direction Geuzenveld . Get off at stop Egidiusstraat. Walk from the tram-/ bus stop in the direction the bus is going. After about 150 meters a Turkish eatery "Birtat" can be found on the right, on the corner of the Baetostraat. 10minutes2center theme the Netherlands is located at Baetostraat 9h.

By car from direction Den Haag/Utrecht/Amersfoort: From the A10 take exit S105 At the exit, go straight passing two traffic lights (these are close to each other) to get on the S104 and keep right. At the end of the exit turn right at the traffic lights. You go straight ahead and where you see Domino's Pizza on the right, you turn left into the Egidiusstraat. Turn left at the end of the street to the Leeuwendalersweg. The sixth street on the left is the Baetostraat. 10minutes2center theme the Netherlands is located at Baetostraat 9h.

By car from direction Zaandam: take exit S104. At the end of the exit turn left. Go straight ahead at the 2 traffic lights and where you see Domino's Pizza on the right, you turn left into the Egidiusstraat. Turn left at the end of the street into the Leeuwendalersweg and the sixth street on the left is the Baetostraat. 10minutes2center theme the Netherlands is located at Baetostraat 9h.

Click here for a map.

Parking We recommend parking your car in the guarded and covered parking "P + R" under the Bos en Lommerplein at Leeuwendalersweg 23b. Parking in a "P + R" costs 8 Euro per 24 hours including a return ticket for public transport for up to 5 people, depending on the number of people. Follow the above directions until right after the 2 traffic lights. Turn left at KFC. Follow this road en the curve to the left. At the end of the road you will see the entrance of the parking. Look at www.parkerenamsterdam.nl for more information. Fast, flexible and free with the bike through Amsterdam? Borrow one or two well-maintained bikes from 10minutes2center!

Payment

The balance due (incl. VAT & Tourist tax) must be paid upon arrival at the apartment. The final payment is done by cash only.

Keys will only be handed out, when the final payment is received

Drugs are strictly prohibited in our apartment.

We look forward to your arrival and wish you a safe trip!

Kind regards,

Janeth

+31 630040156

 

info@10minutes2center.nl

Except in the case of normal wear and tear you are responsible for any damage to the apartment or its contents during your stay, which has occurred due to the negligence, willful default or irresponsible behavior on the part of yourself or those occupying the apartment or their guests. Any damage must be reported to the apartment provider, without delay. You and your party also agree not to act in any way that could cause disturbance to the residents in neighboring properties.

 

Alcohol, Drugs & Tobacco 

The use of drugs and abuse of alcohol is strictly prohibited on the premises. The use and possession of hard drugs is illegal and anyone suspected of either will be reported to the Police. In some apartments smoking inside is allowed, this is stated on the website. It is not allowed to smoke marihuana inside the apartments.

content.short: Compact and comfortable one-bedroom apartment for up to four guests, in the trendy and upcoming West area of Amsterdam.
content.full:
Compact and comfortable one-bedroom apartment for up to four guests, in the trendy and upcoming West area of Amsterdam.

This comfortable accommodation, with an Asian touch, wooden floors and large windows that allow in plenty of natural light, is perfect for two couples or a family. The bright and cheerful living area has a large sofa (converts into a double bed),  a flat screen television with cable and a dining table for four. The separate kitchen is well equipped, and includes an oven, microwave, fridge and freezer. The bedroom has a comfortable double bed. The bathroom is modern and features a toilet, washbasin and shower. This apartment has everything you need for a stay in Amsterdam. Located close to the Erasmus park and easy reachable by public transport, makes this a perfect base from which to explore the city. Breakfast can be requested when booking (€ 15,- per person per day). The host will provide a refrigerator stocked with bread, milk, cheese, eggs, meats and juice.

We offer parking rental for Euro 20 per day
content.area:
This apartment is situated in the West of the City, and is close to all the amenities you may need. Want a bite to eat? Restaurants and cafés are plentiful, and for those who prefer cooking at home – there are plenty of shops in the neighbourhood too.  If relaxation is your thing, then the Erasmus Park is a stone’s throw away, or take a walk to the famous Vondel Park. If you like  shopping, a short bus ride will take you to the heart of Amsterdam’s most exclusive shopping street, the PC Hooftstraat, with designer shops galore.

The Palace on Dam Square and the hectic Kalverstraat shopping street are all only a cycle or bus ride away. Visit the tempting Lindengracht food market on a Saturday morning, or the farmers' market on the Noordermarkt. Just half an hour away is the Museumplein, home to the Van Gogh Museum, the newly reopened Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art and the Rijksmuseum with its collection of world renowned masterworks.  Something for every taste!

The apartment is well situated for getting around Amsterdam. Central Station is just a short bus ride away.
content.arrival:
Dear guest,

Thank you for booking your Amsterdam apartment with us!

Please read the following information carefully as it provides you with the information for a smooth check-in.

Please inform us via email info@10minutes2center.nl with your estimated time of arrival as soon as possible.

Once you have arrived at Schiphol airport, Amsterdam Central Station or enter Amsterdam’s city ring please call +31 630040156.This will enable us to estimate your arrival time at the apartment.

Check-in

Check-in is at the apartment (address: Marieken van Nimwegenstraat 11A ) from 14:00.

An early check-in between before 14:00 is not always possible, but can be requested. For availability, please contact us two days prior to your arrival.

Check-out

Check-out is before 11:00 in the morning. A late check-out (till 18:00) can be requested. Please note that this depends on the availability of the apartment.

Payment

The balance due (incl. VAT & Tourist tax) must be paid upon arrival at the apartment. The final payment is done by cash only.

Keys will only be handed out, when the final payment is received.

Directions

Trein: om in Bos en Lommer te komen kunt u de trein vanaf Schiphol nemen. De reistijd is ongeveer 30 minuten en de kosten zijn ongeveer Euro 6. U neemt de trein van Schiphol naar station Sloterdijk. Daar neemt u bus 15 en stapt uit bij het Bos en Lommerplein. U loopt in de richting waarin ook de bus gaat. Bij de oversteekplaats linksaf en aan de overkant doorlopen tot het eind. De eerste rechtsaf de Marieken van Nimwegenstraat in. Na ongeveer 150 meter op nummer 11a (hoek Marieken van Nimwegenstraat/Lanseloetstraat), aan de rechterkant van de straat vindt u 10minutes2center thema Thailand.

Met openbaar vervoer vanaf Centraal Station Amsterdam: Bus 21: richting Geuzenveld. Uitstappen op halte "Egidiusstraat". U loopt vanaf de tram- en bushalte een stukje terug naar “Domino’s Pizza”. Hier de Egidiusstraat inlopen. Tweede straat rechtsaf de Marieken van Nimwegenstraat in. Na ongeveer 150 meter op nummer 11a (hoek Marieken van Nimwegenstraat/Lanseloetstraat), aan de linkerkant van de straat vindt u 10minutes2center thema Thailand.

Met de auto vanuit richting Den Haag/Utrecht/Amersfoort: Vanaf de A10, neemt u de afslag S105, Onderaan de afslag gaat u rechtdoor bij beide stoplichten (deze staan vlak na elkaar) en houdt vervolgens rechts aan, zo komt u op afrit s104. Aan het eind van de afslag gaat u bij de stoplichten rechtsaf. U gaat rechtdoor bij de volgende 2 stoplichten en waar u Domino's Pizza ziet gaat u rechtsaf de Egidiusstraat in. Tweede straat rechts de Marieken van Nimwegenstraat in. Na ongeveer 150 meter op nummer 11a (hoek Marieken van Nimwegenstraat/Lanseloetstraat), aan de linkerkant van de straat vindt u 10minutes2center thema Thailand.

Met de auto vanuit de richting Zaandam neemt u afslag s104. Onderaan de afslag gaat u linksaf. U gaat rechtdoor bij de volgende 2 stoplichten en waar u Domino's Pizza ziet gaat u rechtsaf de Egidiusstraat in. Tweede straat rechts de Marieken van Nimwegenstraat in. Na ongeveer 150 meter op nummer 11a (hoek Marieken van Nimwegenstraat/Lanseloetstraat), aan de linkerkant van de straat vindt u 10minutes2center thema Thailand.

Klik hier voor de kaart.

Parkeren Wij adviseren om uw auto te parkeren in de bewaakte en overdekte parkeerplaats "P+R" onder het Bos en Lommerplein (Leeuwendalersweg 23b). Parkeren op een "P+R" kost Euro 8.00 per 24 uur inclusief openbaar vervoer kaartjes voor maximaal 5 personen, afhankelijk van het aantal personen. Als u de routebeschrijving hierboven heeft gevolgd tot na de 2 stoplichten gaat u linksaf bij KFC. Deze weg volgen langs het Gulden Winckelplantsoen, de bocht naar links volgen. Na 150 meter vindt u links de ingang na de parkeergarage. Snel, flexibel en gratis met de fiets door Amsterdam? Leen 1 of 2 goed onderhouden fietsen van 10minutes2center! Kijk op www.parkerenamsterdam.nl voor meer informatie.

Drugs are strictly prohibited in our apartment.

We look forward to your arrival and wish you a safe trip!

Kind regards,

Janeth

+31 630040156

info@10minutes2center.nl

: journey takes about 30 minutes and costs about 6 Euro,-. Take the train from Schiphol airport to Station Sloterdijk. There you take bus 15 and get off at the Bos en Lommerplein. Walk in the direction the bus is going until the crossing and cross the street to the left. Proceed until the end and turn left. Turn right into the first street, this is the Marieken van Nimwegenstraat. After about 150 meters, on the right hand side, at number 11b 10minutes2center theme Brazil can be found. The entrance is in the garden.

Public transport from Amsterdam Central Station: Bus 21: direction Geuzenveld . Get off at stop Egidiusstraat. Walk from the tram-/ bus stop towards “Domino’s Pizza”. Enter the Egidiusstraat. The entrance is in the garden.

Parking in a "P + R" costs 8 Euro per 24 hours including a return ticket for public transport for up to 5 people, depending on the number of people. Follow the above directions until right after the 2 traffic lights. Turn left at KFC. Follow this road en the curve to the left. At the end of the road you will see the entrance of the parking. property.name: Albert Cuyp III A studio Amsterdam

content.short: Modern studio apartment, housing up to two people in Amsterdam’s Pijp district, overlooking the vibrant Albert Cuyp Market.
content.full:
Modern studio apartment, housing up to two people in Amsterdam’s Pijp district, overlooking the vibrant Albert Cuyp Market.

The residence boasts an authentic location in a popular neighbourhood brimming with cafes, restaurants, bars and boutiques. Tastefully furnished throughout, the studio benefits from beautiful wooden floors, plenty of natural light and a many modern amenities. The combined living and sleeping area comes equipped with two double beds, large wardrobes, a coffee table, cosy rug, an impressive wall hanging. A flatscreen TV provided for the evening’s entertainment. The kitchen includes a fridge and freezer, offering the option of home dining during your stay. A small yet pleasant balcony allows you to enjoy the sunshine in peace. The bathroom contains a washbasin and a shower, with the toilet situated separately for added convenience. The studio also includes high speed Wi-Fi. Perfect for a family or two couples, the lodging ensures a memorable Amsterdam adventure.

Please note: Our stairs is not child friendly and we do not have a space for prams and strollers. We do not accept families with small children and babies for safety reasons.
content.area:
The accommodation can be found south of the historical centre, lining one of the country’s most famous market streets. Existing over a 100 years, the Albert Cuypmarkt attracts a diverse crowd and enjoys a bustling yet laid back atmosphere, making it the perfect introduction to typical Amsterdam life. This animated attraction is located in the Pijp quarter, renowned for its multicultural population and its multitude of friendly bars, cafes and restaurants, providing more ethnic eateries than any other part of the city.

The studio is superbly placed for discovering Amsterdam’s stunning Canal Belt and its equally picturesque river, the Amstel. Accessible on foot in a matter of minutes, this elegant waterway hosts several cultural venues along its banks, including the Royal Carre Theatre and the Hermitage Museum. The capital’s famous Dam Square can be reached on foot in half an hour or by tram in less than fifteen minutes.

We require a security deposit upon check in. We will hold Euro 100 in cash upon check-in.

This amount will be returned to you in cash or by bank transfer after your stay.

When the check-out is at reasonable times this amount will be returned to you in cash during check-out on the conditions that you have left the apartment in a good condition and no disturbance has occurred. Should you have an early check out the deposit payment will be done by bank transfer.

Keys will only be handed out, when the final payment is received and the security deposit is settled.

Drugs are strictly prohibited in our apartment.

We look forward to your arrival and wish you a safe trip!

Kind regards,

Angel and Denise

+31 684658367

amsterdam-holiday@outlook.com

property.name: Albert Cuyp III B studio Amsterdam

content.short: An intimite and cosy studio in Amsterdam, for two people, just a short journey from the centre and the Heineken brewery.
content.full:
An intimite and cosy studio in Amsterdam, for two people, just a short journey from the centre and the Heineken brewery.

If you are travelling to Amsterdam with your partner and want easy access to the centre and most of the main attractions, then this studio is ideal for you. Located central to Museumplein, the Rijksmuseum, the Heineken brewery and the Keizergracht, you could not wish for a more prime location. The studio itself is warm and welcoming with a beautiful dark-wood floor, elegant lighting, a charming dining table with seating for two guests,, a flat screen TV, a DVD player and a comfortable single beds. The kitchen area is compact but comes complete with everything needed to prepare a delicious meal such as microwave. The bathroom has been completely remodelled and is fitted out with a powerful shower. For your comfort there is a washing machine, a hairdryer, linen, towels and a hi-speed Internet connection. For location and quality, this studio will help make your stay in Amsterdam a memorable one.

Please note: Our stairs is not child friendly and we do not have a space for prams and strollers. We do not accept families with small children and babies for safety reasons.

Registration number: 0363 511D D128 9244 50BB
content.area: The location of this apartment is premium, with easy access to the Museumplein, with the van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, with the world famous “Nightwatch” now fully restored to its former glory. A short distance in the other direction is the Hermitage Museum and the Heineken brewery for a great day out when visiting. Of course Amsterdam is world famous for its canals,restaurants and bars on all its numerous Squares. One such square is the Leidesplein and here you can enjoy a cold drink on a terrace, a delicious meal or even visit the legendary Paradiso , where everyone from U2 to the Rolling stones have performed. With so many restaurants around, a strong recommendation is “Greetje” on the Peperstraat near Centraal Station. If museums and bars are not your thing then why not visit the world’s only floating flower market on Singel canal, near Muntplein. Amsterdam is also home to the oldest stock exchange in the world and of course no visit here is complete without seeing the Anne Frank house, in the Jordaan district.
content.arrival:
Dear guest,

Thank you for booking your Amsterdam apartment with us!

Please read the following information carefully as it provides you with the information for a smooth check-in.

Please inform us via email: amsterdam-holiday@outlook.com with your estimated time of arrival as soon as possible.

Once you have arrived at Schiphol airport, Amsterdam Central Station or enter Amsterdam’s city ring please contact us on our check-in telephone +31 684658367. This will enable us to estimate your arrival time at the apartment.

Check-in

Check-in is at the apartment (address: Albert Cuypstraat 262,3rd floor) from 14:00.

An early check-in between before 14:00 is not always possible, but can be requested. For availability, please contact us two days prior to your arrival. For an early or late check-in an additional 30 euro is charged.

Check-out

Check-out is before 11:00 in the morning. A late check-out (till 18:00) can be requested. Please note that this depends on the availability of the apartment. For a late check-out an additional 50 euro is charged.

Payment

The balance due (incl. VAT & Tourist tax) must be paid upon arrival at the apartment. The final payment is done by cash only.

We look forward to your arrival and wish you a safe trip!

Kind regards,

Angel

property.name: Yays Zoutkeetsgracht Concierged Boutique Apartments Zoutkeetsgracht 202
YAYS Concierged Boutique Apartments: Bickersgracht 5 A

content.short: Stylish one bedroom accomodation with a cozy living room and a lovely patio, housing up to two guests within metres of Artis Zoo in Amsterdam’s peaceful Plantage Quarter.
content.full:
Stylish one bedroom accommodation with a cozy living room and a lovely patio, housing up to two guests from within metres of Artis Zoo in Amsterdam’s peaceful Plantage Quarter.

Surrounded by leafy avenues, tranquil parks and cultural gems, the lodging is wonderfully situated for enjoying authentic Amsterdam life at a more relaxed pace. The accommodation is bright and modern, and features a range of premium amenities on hand for a satisfying stay. The living area comes equipped with a sofa, armchair, flatscreen smart TV and a trendy dining table. The pantry is well equipped with a dishwasher, microwave, toaster, fridge, freezer, kettle egg boiler and a coffee machine, perfect for hearty breakfasts and sumptuous lunches. The bedroom has one double bed, a bathroom with a double washbasin and a luxurious walk-in shower. The toilet is located separately for added convenience. The residence also boasts a high-speed Wi-Fi connection and a sunny patio, perfect for relaxing in the warm summer months. For a welcoming home away from home in a superb neighbourhood, look no further than this quality Amsterdam accommodation.

"The accommodation is situated in the ground level and therefor is part of the house and not an entire house". 

Note: There is no stove available at the property, but the kitchen is equipped with kitchen equipment to prepare good meals and snacks. 

Registration number: 0363 C12F 7058 B036 15E7
content.area:
Renowned for its rich heritage, fascinating museums and abundant greenery, the Plantage Quarter makes the perfect spot from which to explore the best of the Dutch capital. The apartment can be found nestled between two popular sights for nature lovers, the historic Artis Zoo and the calming Hortus Botanical Gardens. The mind boggling Micropia, emotive Verzetsmuseum and the stunning Portuguese Synagogue are also close at hand, and Amsterdam’s famous canals and primary transport hub of Central Station are reachable on foot in just 15 minutes.

A great selection of bars, restaurants, stores and cafes populate the vicinity. Recommended culinary highlights range from the cosy breakfast joint of Coffee to Walk to the tasty Ethiopian haven of Kilimanjaro.

content.short: Charming and wonderful studio apartment in the vibrant Jordaan area, in the heart of Amsterdam.
content.full:
Charming and wonderful studio apartment in the vibrant Jordaan area, in the heart of Amsterdam.

This light, and surprisingly spacious, street level studio apartment in an old 17th century warehouse offers comfortable accommodation for two people in the heart of the trendy Jordaan district of Amsterdam. The living area has a wooden floor and is furnished with a large comfortable sofa, armchair and TV with cable and DVD player. The semi-open kitchen is adequately equipped, including a hob, and fridge freezer.The carpeted sleeping area, at the back of the apartment, features a double bed, bedside tables and lamps. The adjoining bathroom has a bath / shower combination, a washbasin and a toilet. Amenities provided include Wifi and a secure bike lock-up. With delightful views out onto the popular Prinsengracht (canal), you will really get a feel of Amsterdam living. Throw open the beautiful French doors and simply watch life pass you by on the street outside. This 55m2 studio apartment offers a great base from which to explore bustling Amsterdam whether on foot or by bike.

Registration number: 0363 E7F5 F21C 8FF7 3111
content.area:
The Prinsengracht is one of Amsterdam’s four main canals. In the heart of the trendy Jordaan district, with its eclectic collection of boutiques, cafés and restaurants, the apartment is a perfect base from which to explore the city (and its nightlife).

The Palace on Dam Square, the hectic Kalverstraat shopping street and the calm of the Vondel park are all only a short walk away. Visit the tempting Lindengracht food market on a Saturday morning, or walk round the corner to the farmers' market on the Noordermarkt. Also on your doorstep are the “Negen straatjes” (9 streets), home to many of Amsterdam’s exciting smaller boutiques. Just a ten minute walk away is the Museumplein, home to the Van Gogh Museum, the newly reopened Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art and the Rijksmuseum with its collection of world renowned masterworks. Something for every taste!

For those of you who want to venture a little further afield, hop on one of the many trams to take you across Amsterdam. The main train station, Central Station is also just a stone’s throw away.

content.full:
Spacious and very comfortable furnished apartment for rent in a unique location in the center of Groningen! This attractive, double upstairs apartment is 100 years old. Many authentic elements have been preserved and new ones have been added. In terms of comfort and appearance, it has been completely adapted to the requirements of our modern times. A surprising and unique whole!

Ground floor: closed entrance with bell and private staircase.

Apartment: bright hall with beautifully tiled toilet with washbasin, wardrobe, and access doors with stained glass windows to the attractive living room with double sofa bed. At the rear of the room you will find a high, wall-to-wall glass facade with access doors to a small terrace. Here you will find the sitting area with a view of the green oasis of the terrace. At the front is the handmade kitchen, which is equipped with the following built-in appliances: a gas stove (Smeg), an oven (Whirlpool), a dishwasher (Bosch), a Nespresso machine, a fridge and freezer (Whirlpool), a washing machine (Indesit), a coffee maker (Philips), a combi microwave and extractor (Whirlpool), a kettle (Philips), and a vacuum cleaner (Miele). There are beautiful wooden floorboards on the floor and a chimney without fire place.

Registration #: 001477EB5CE014231193

Second floor: here you will find a unique bedroom and bathroom with a double bed, a large bath, a special walk-in shower with rain shower and wash bowl and a standing toilet. There is also a wooden floor on this floor. At the front, three windows provide pleasant light and at the rear are sliding doors to a spacious, sheltered, and sunny roof terrace, where you can lounge with an unobstructed view of the surroundings. Here you can enjoy the tranquility in the middle of the bustling city center. 

Parking: parking is only possible in the parking garages 200 m away with fee.
content.area:
The house is located in a prime location in one of the nicest shopping streets in the city! In the car-free street you will mainly find some smaller, separate shops. But of course, the supermarket is also not far, because it is only 100 m from the house, as well as the Vismarkt, where a large market is held on Tuesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. At the nearby Zuiderdiep you will find a wide choice of terraces, cafes, and restaurants, as well as the cinema. Well-known Groningen attractions such as the Martini Tower, Groninger forum and Groninger Museum are all within walking distance and the University of Groningen is also nearby.

This also applies to the bus stop and the railway station in Groningen, which is less than a 10-minute walk away. You can park your car in the parking garages 200 m from the house. The A7 motorway is just a few minutes' drive away.

property.name: Beautiful Apartment With Asian Style Amsterdam

content.full:
In the B&B bedroom is a private shower and sink, the toilet is separate and private for you. 2 Queenside beds, 2 extra single floor mattresses if needed. 4 Glass doors looking out over the beautiful garden with BBQ possibilities. With doors wide open, or sitting on the huge lounge set, one can relax after enjoying Amsterdam. Access to Living room and kitchen. Whole apartment just renovated. Museums, hip shop/dining district and the house where ANNE FRANK grew up all within walking distance.

 

The space

The B&B private room with Asian influences is 25m2. and has a private shower cabin and separate private toilet. The whole house is a beautiful large apartment of 120 m2 with designer furniture and a sunny garden of 70m2.

 

 

Guest access

The guests have their own private shower, toilet is separate and private. In the bedroom of 25m2 there are 2 queen size beds. Also I have comfy floor mattress if needed. There are 4 doors which give access to the garden of 70m2. In the garden one can make use of the lounge seating area and you can BBQ. Also there is a hammock in the exentension. With the doors wide open, one can enjoy a good book or a glass of wine after enjoying Amsterdam. I'm open for people on business trips, but also for people who are enjoying amsterdam in the broadest way.

 

Fresh Towels and bed sheets are available for my guests.

 

License number

0363 97CE E6A5 BDC3 2A47
content.area:
ll of history, for example at the end of the street is the house of ANNE FRANK where she lived before she went into hiding. The apartment is very close to all the highways A10; A4 etc, The RAI station witch is the stop for all public transport to go to center (6 Min) or out of Amsterdam.RAI conference center, the heart of the commerce De Zuidas,all Famous Museums, like VAN GOGH, RIJKS, STEDELIJK, the exclusive shopping street De PC as well as De Pijp district (with lots of hip bars, restaurants, and shops), The world famous Albert Cuyp Market, Etc, all walking distance. The area is very wanted by locals due to its safe, peaceful and very cosy atmosphere. It is very centrally located, close to the Leidseplein, Rembrandsplein, Museumplein and the Vondelpark

All of these places are easy to be reached by public transport, (just around the corner), by foot, or you can rent a bicycle ( in the building) and feel extra Dutch!
content.arrival:
Welcome to our pet-friendly bed and breakfast (BnB), where we understand that your furry friend is an important member of your family. We are pleased to offer you the possibility of bringing your dog along with you during your stay, provided that certain conditions are met.

For a fee of 35 EUR, you can bring your well-behaved and potty-trained dog to our BnB. We believe that responsible pet ownership is essential to ensure a pleasant experience for all our guests. Therefore, we kindly request that your dog is properly trained to relieve themselves outside and not inside the premises and that your dog doesn't bark excessively.

Moreover, we have a strict policy that prohibits leaving dogs alone in the BnB. This is to prevent any potential distress or damage that may occur when a dog is unsupervised. We recommend planning activities that allow you to enjoy your time together with your furry companion.

Please note that bringing a dog to our BnB is subject to availability. Therefore, we encourage you to inform us in advance of your intention to bring your dog, so we can make the necessary arrangements.

We look forward to welcoming you and your furry friend to our pet-friendly BnB. Together, we can create a memorable and enjoyable experience for all.
